alert.note: Alert for Northern Elko County; Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 30 at 1:27PM PST until December 03 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Elko
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 1-5 inches in the valleys and areas below 6000 feet. Above 6000 feet, expect 6 to 18 inches of snow, with localized heavier amounts. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph in the highest terrain. * WHERE...Northern Elko County and Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range. * WHEN...From Thursday evening through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. A winter storm warning means significant amounts of snow, sleet, and ice are expected or occurring. Strong winds are also possible. This will make travel very hazardous or impossible. For the latest road conditions call 511 or visit http://www.nvroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Northern Elko County; Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range
